N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 487.3 - Uniform investigative procedures

State Regulations
(a) Written guidelines on conducting
investigations into consumer product tampering incidents have been made
available to appropriate agencies by the Crime Analysis Unit of the Division of

State Police. Additional copies of such guidelines shall be made available to
appropriate agencies upon written request to the Crime Analysis Unit, Division
of State Police, Building 22, State Campus, Albany, NY 12226. However, as
consumer product tampering incidents occur, specific recommendations and
investigative assistance or support regarding such incidents may be obtained
directly from local troop headquarters or the Crime Analysis Unit at division
headquarters upon request. (b) The
general purpose of these written guidelines is to ensure that thorough and
uniform procedures are used by all agencies in the investigation of consumer
product tampering complaints. Specifically, the objectives of the investigation
are to determine: (1)
if a consumer product
tampering has occurred; (2)
the
seriousness of the problem; (3)
the
quantity of the affected product; (4)
the nature and source of the consumer
product tampering; (5)
appropriate
methods to remove potentially hazardous consumer products from the marketplace; and
(6)
the identity of the person
or persons responsible, and taking appropriate action. (c) The New York State Police may, upon
request, act as the coordinating agency in the investigation of consumer
product tampering complaints. For information on State and Federal agencies
which may play a role in consumer product tampering investigations and their
general areas of responsibility, appropriate agencies are encouraged to contact
the local troop headquarters or the Crime Analysis Unit of the Division of

State Police. Notes
